alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 1:53AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... James River at Lamoure affecting LaMoure, Dickey and Stutsman Counties. Souris River near Foxholm affecting Ward County. Souris River near Bantry affecting McHenry County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Souris River near Towner affecting McHenry County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Souris River near Towner. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1456.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flood problems begin with agricultural land and meadows affected. At 1456.2 feet, Secondary roads become covered with water. Farmers on the right side of the river looking downstream will be affected but little damage. Water bypasses gage at this height. At 1456.7 feet, Widespread flooding west and north of town with many roads affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 1456.2 feet. - Forecast...Moderate to minor flooding is expected to continue through this week. - Flood stage is 1454.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1456.6 feet on 04/03/1987. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
